subject: Personal Finance
title: Secured vs Unsecured Debt
description: A 60-second lesson on Secured vs Unsecured Debt.

hook.text: Miss a car payment and they take the car. Miss a credit card payment and they send angry letters.

buildup.text: Secured debt is backed by collateral â€” an asset the lender can seize if you don't pay.

discovery.text: Mortgages and auto loans are secured. Credit cards and personal loans are unsecured.

twist.text: Secured debt usually has lower interest rates because the lender's risk is lower.

climax.text: Unsecured debt charges more because the lender has no fallback if you default.

punchline.text: Collateral lowers the price of borrowing.

quiz.question: What makes debt 'secured'?
options: It's backed by an asset the lender can seize
